textList.name: START_BEACON_ENGI
textList.text: You have arrived in Automaton space. The Hissho invasion has been threatening the Automaton core worlds. The Automatons are friendly, but they can't guarantee your safety any more.
You have arrived in Automaton space. The secession war and the Hissho invasion has brought tough times for these robotic lifeforms, but they're usually willing to help.

textList.name: STORE_ENGI
textList.text: The Automatons can do remarkable things with nothing but metal and Dust. The community at this beacon is selling equipment for just that.
A message arrives: "Your Dust, ours. Our weapons for you." You're about to raise the shields when you realise it's just an Automaton trader looking for a trade.
An Automaton ship hails: "Engine upgrade necessary for travel home. Sale of equipment necessary for engine upgrade."

textList.name: NOTHING_ENGI
textList.text: The complex arrangements of ship hulls and FTL drive capacitors floating abandoned in space suggest the Automatons were here not too long ago, but no longer.

You arrive at a green planet with great plains and rolling waterfalls. During peacetime, the Automatons would have cherished this environment. Since the Hissho invasion, this planet must have been of too little strategic value to defend.

You have arrived near an Automaton colony. They have been constructing a sort of living shipyard, but you can tell that the Hissho have attacked it again and again. It is barely maintaining structural integrity; you get the sense that the structure itself is in pain.

Even though each "individual" Automaton is made up of trillions of nano-machines, their culture still revolves around traditional social interactions. A nearby station seems to be constructed for entertainment of passing Automatons.

You see a number of Automaton space stations and fleets nearby. Despite looking like piles of junk loosely tied together they are actually a model of efficiency. They just lack a certain aesthetic emphasis in their constructions.
This system appears quite peaceful. You're not sure how long it'll last against the Hissho blitz.

There are a number of merchant ships passing through the area despite the threat of Hissho invasion. No doubt they are interested in buying the unique, strangely organic products made by the Automatons.
You see a small UE carrier in the distance. You lay low and try to blend in with the other traffic. It's surprising to see a human military ship alone deep in Automaton space.
The Automaton seem to have avoided this particular node, along with every other life-form. You keep your eyes peeled for reasons why, but spin up the FTL without event.
A cluster of Automaton satellites in orbit of a nearby planet are the only clue the Automatons were ever here. The planet is burning...

textList.name: ENGI_GIFT
textList.text: An Automaton vessel hails you. "Identity: Pilgrim? Outlier probability. Implies... revival. Implies... hope. Assistance suggested." They offer some supplies.
You cross paths with an Automaton cargo vessel hurrying home before the Hissho fleets attempt to take over this sector. They're happy to offload some of their cargo to get home faster.
You make contact with an isolated Automaton science station who are staying put despite the likelihood of Hissho invasion. They suggest you trial some experimental technology.
This was the site of a recent battle. Either a show of Hissho force, or the Automatons here weren't disposed to go peacefully. You pick through the pieces.

event.name: ENGI_FLEET_DELAY
event.text: You notice an Automaton colony hiding on the other side of a nearby moon. It turns out they're excavating an equipment cache from the Human-Hissho War, and they suggest it might be used to lure the pursuing fleet.
You transfer down some missile warheads and the Automatons rig them to blow before setting a distress signal to attract the fleet's attention.
You have the Automatons complete their excavations and bring the supplies on-board.

event.name: ENGI_MONSTER
event.text: As you jump in you're hailed urgently by an Automaton science vessel in the distance. "We propose that you do not see the creature." There's nothing on the scanner, which is when you realise you can't see the creature because you're inside it!
You detect a faint, arrhythmic sub-wave pattern. Could the creature be communicating? You forward your observations to the Automaton vessel and they thank you in turn.
You detect a faint, arrhythmic sub-wave pattern. Could the creature be communicating? You forward your observations to the Automaton vessel and they thank you in turn.

event.name: ENGI_SURRENDER
event.text: An Automaton ship in the vicinity, seeing you jump in armed to the teeth, immediately broadcasts its surrender: "Subject goal: wealth. Automaton motivation: survival. Transfer of goods acceptable?"
The Automaton obediently transfer over the goods and get on their way. Money for nothing.
The Automaton seem relieved, and eager to get underway. They set off without saying goodbye.

The Automaton are satisfied with your explanation. "Beneficial. Subject goal: long, long journey. Remains compatible with transfer of goods from Automaton." They send over the gear willingly, and you feel better for it.

textList.name: ENGI_MANTIS_FIGHT
textList.text: A mixed radar signal turns out to be a Hissho attack ship scavenging the remains of an Automaton carrier. They turn and fight.

You come across a Hissho raider taking pot shots at a defenceless Automaton supply station. Discovering its weapons aren't much of a match for the station's armour, it turns on your ship. Battlestations!
The area looks clear, and you prepare to jump off, but a Hissho scout jumps in behind you! They're as surprised as you are, but their weapons are already online.
You find a Hissho ship harrying a small squad of Automaton. They make it to the node and jump off, leaving you toe to toe with their pursuer!

event.name: ENGI_REBEL_FIGHT
event.text: You jump in near a small United Empire ship. A fighter that size couldn't get this deep into space on its own; he must have gotten lost, been part of a convoy or something. He's not going to be around long enough to tell anyone about you.

event.name: ENGI_PIRATE_FIGHT
event.text: There must have been rich pickings for pirates around here up until war broke out. The pirate you encounter here looks worn down, but hungry. You'll have to fight!

event.name: ENGI_STATION_DISTRESS
event.text: You receive a distress call from a nearby Automaton ship. "Assistance requested. Danger present. Imminent destruction."

choice.text: Respond to the call and move in to assist.

event.text: You receive another message from the ship, this time with a Hissho at the com-log. "Foolish meatsacks," he yells. Sensors indicate the ship is moving in to attack and boarders teleport from the station.
You approach to find a Hissho ship assaulting a small Automaton space station. You prepare for a fight!
The Automaton station is stripped bare and there are signs of a fierce battle. The Hissho must have left the distress call active to lure other ships into a trap.
The station was in the process of being evacuated. A number of civilian Automatons offer their gratitude as they finalize their preparations to leave. They offer some fuel as a reward.
The station hails you, "Gratitude. Expected probability of defeat without assistance... 86.2 percent. Request suitable reward."
"Request granted. Fuel transferring."
"Request granted. Weapon transferring."
"Request granted. Drone schematic transferring."

choice.text: (Engi Crew) Threat unresolved. Current mission imperative: Protocol 52.34.

event.text: They respond, "Understood. Successful human division of highest import. Transmitting hidden base coordinates. Repairing hull and attaching ship to ship ordnance."
They thank you for the assistance and when you tell them of your mission, one of the Automatons asks if he can assist your crew. You welcome him aboard.

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REBEL
event.text: The distress signal originates at a small Automaton ship under attack by a Hissho fighter - but when they see Pilgrim markings they turn to attack!

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REBEL_RESULT
event.text: The Automaton vessel turns out to be very poorly equipped - barely a runabout, really. They're trying to outrun the Hissho, and need all the help they can get.

choice.text: Give them 40 Dust, 2 missiles and 2 fuel.

event.text: Automatons can't feel fear, so they bear you no ill will when you explain you're unwilling to help. They set off on their journey and you do the same.
The words they use are "Need = fulfilled", but you take it for gratitude. They take the next jump in their long journey home.
The Automatons are grateful. They don't have any supplies or weapons to spare, but they do have some Dust.
The Automatons are grateful. They don't have much by way of supplies but they do offer a drone schematic for your use.

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REBEL_LIST2
event.text: They wouldn't get more than a few jumps with that load-out. You provide them with all the munitions and supplies they should need for the journey home. "Generosity magnitude unpredicted. Well-being syntax error [value too high]. Accept this token."

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REACTOR
event.text: You arrive at a smoldering Automaton research station, its distress call unanswered - attacked by pirates or Hissho most likely. There may be someone left alive, or else something of value left on board.
The place looks in bad state, probably nothing of use there. Time to move on.
You send an away team to investigate, but there's nothing save for the acidic stench of burnt Automaton parts. This place is dead.
Your away team reports a wounded Automaton and a functioning drone schematic. Then someone yells. The station reactor is overloading and they're running out of time!
It's a tough order, but your crew's lives are the priority. They drop everything and return to ship unharmed. You put some distance on the station before it blows.

One of your crew valiantly grabs the Automaton and throws it into the airlock right before the reactor blows and the automatic blast doors slam shut. You have no choice but to mourn their sacrifice and move on.
The Automaton who was saved offers to join your crew.
Your crew return safely to the airlock with the injured Automaton and you put some distance on the station before it blows. The Automaton, impressed by your crew, volunteers to join you.
Your away team heads home with the goods, but as they transfer back to the ship a small explosion blows the airlock and one of the crew is sucked out into space!

The Automaton don't feel things the same way other species do. They'd want the tech to be saved. Your crew return safely to the airlock with the drone control and you put some distance on the station before it blows.

event.name: DISTRESS_ENGI_REACTOR_SCAN
event.text: Scans reveal the station's reactor is overloading! Not only that, but an injured Automaton and a functioning drone schematic are still on board! There's not time for both...

Your away team heads straight for the Automaton and returns with time to spare. You put some distance on the station before it blows and the Automaton is so impressed by your crew that they volunteer to join you!

The Automaton don't feel things the same way other species do. They'd want the tech to be saved. Your away team heads straight for the goods and returns with time to spare. You put some distance on the station before it blows.

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_1
event.text: You arrive near a small fleet of civilian Automaton ships. A simple decryption and translation of their comm frequency tells you that they are having a frantic discussion about something obviously troubling them.

choice.text: Message them and ask if you can help.

event.text: Slightly shocked at your question, their leader quickly responds, "Declined offer with apologetic gratitude. Topic of discussion private matter, no concern of smaller human faction."
You can't help but wonder what they were discussing as you prepare to jump.

choice.text: (Automaton Crew) Have your Automaton crew member contact them.

event.text: Your crew member syncs with the comm unit to communicate with them directly. You offer your help and a summary of the ship's mission. They respond, "Our goals have analogous elements. However, not all available for disclosure, discretion necessary."
"Secret technologies stolen by Hissho. Implicit connection to Empire. Implicit. Tracked Hissho to hidden Empire base, uploading coordinates."

"However, tracked second ship to different base. Would calculate probability but data insufficient. Cannot risk obvious Human-Automaton conflict. Also, need time to acquire military ships. Assist in finding technology?"

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_2FAKE
event.text: You arrive at one of the loyalist bases that the Automatons told you about. It appears abandoned except for one scout ship. Perhaps you could extract information from them.

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_2FAKE_SURRENDER
event.text: "Stop! I don't want to die here."

choice.text: Demand information on the stolen technology.

event.text: "Ah, so that's what you're after. Too bad, you followed the wrong ship. The envoy that passed through here was a fake, to trick fools like you. Now let us go!"
"No, wait..." You cut the transmission and continue the assault.

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_2REAL
event.text: You arrive at one of the loyalist bases that the Automatons told you about. It appears abandoned except for one scout ship. Perhaps you could extract information from them."

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_2REAL_SURRENDER
event.text: "Stop! This isn't worth dying for..."

choice.text: Demand information on the stolen technology.

event.text: "Of course, that's why you're here. Yes, they passed by here but I had nothing to do with it, I don't know what they were carrying. I'll transmit coordinates. Now just let us go..."
You prepare an FTL message containing the coordinates to send to the Automatons and get ready to jump.

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_3
event.text: You have finally caught up with the ships you've been hunting. A hangar-sized cargo ship is being escorted by a number of Hissho ships. As you reconsider the assault, a squadron of Automaton ships with pirate emblems jump in and assist you. You prepare to fight the Hissho but scans indicate they are manned by humans!

event.name: ENGI_UNLOCK_4
event.text: The Automaton emerge victorious from their battles with only minor losses. They message you, "Project X-ME56 commissioned by Pilgrim military research division. Advanced stealth cruiser. Project finished post-bellum. Unable to reconnect with Pilgrim military command."
"Likely ploy by Empire to avoid breaking non-aggression pact with Automaton. 97.56 percent likely. Your mission to assist last Pilgrim fleet, correct? Coordinates?"

"Satisfactory. Delivery of tech will assist in Pilgrim cause. Gratitude alone insufficient. Commencing ship repair and compensation." Their crews deliver a weapon for installation but you're more pleased to hear that the Pilgrims will have an improved arsenal.
event.unlockShip: The secret tech has been delivered to the hangar. The stealth ship has been unlocked!
